comment._content: Actually, not German: Victor Herbert was born in Ireland, to English-speaking parents. His mother's second husband may have been German, but Victor wasn't. He was educated in Germany, but had his career in America, where he wrote his operettas in English. He was regarded as an American composer.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The photo above was taken in April, 1914, aboard a ship in New York harbor, when Herbert was embarking with his family for Europe. Arriving in London, he was conducted on a tour of Buckingham Palace, when he suddenly became ill with an attack of appendicitis. An emergency operation soon put him back to rights. This April 26, 1914, story about his illness, in the New York Times, notes that he had arrived from New York only a week earlier: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=940DE7D6163AE6...
